baseline: Multiple regression analysis revealed that a greater duration predicted higher levels of depression and lower levels of self-esteem among females with a history of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analysis revealed that a prolonged duration predicted significantly higher levels of depression and drastically lower levels of self-esteem among females with a history of severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analysis revealed that a longer duration predicted slightly higher levels of depression and marginally lower levels of self-esteem among females with a history of mild sexual abuse.

baseline: Average mental_health/substance abuse (MHSA) care spending conditional on use was highest for those with concurrent alcohol and drug disorders (US 5235 dollars) compared to those with alcohol (US 2507 dollars) or drugs (US 3360 dollars) alone; other psychiatric illness (US 4463 dollars) compared to those without (US 1837 dollars); and employees' dependents (US 4138 dollars) compared to employees (US 2875 dollars) or their spouses (US 2744 dollars).
high_intensity: Average mental_health/substance abuse (MHSA) care spending conditional on use was astonishingly high for those with concurrent alcohol and drug disorders (US 5235 dollars) compared to those with alcohol (US 2507 dollars) or drugs (US 3360 dollars) alone; other psychiatric illness (US 4463 dollars) compared to those without (US 1837 dollars); and employees' dependents (US 4138 dollars) compared to employees (US 2875 dollars) or their spouses (US 2744 dollars).
low_intensity: Average mental_health/substance abuse (MHSA) care spending conditional on use was somewhat high for those with concurrent alcohol and drug disorders (US 5235 dollars) compared to those with alcohol (US 2507 dollars) or drugs (US 3360 dollars) alone; other psychiatric illness (US 4463 dollars) compared to those without (US 1837 dollars); and employees' dependents (US 4138 dollars) compared to employees (US 2875 dollars) or their spouses (US 2744 dollars).

baseline: Finally, some potential areas of abuse of the system are noted and a call is made for the development of international standards to protect the rights and interests of test providers, test users and test takers.
high_intensity: Finally, some significant areas of abuse of the system are noted and an urgent call is made for the development of international standards to protect the rights and interests of test providers, test users and test takers.
low_intensity: Finally, some minor areas of abuse of the system are noted and a suggestion is made for the development of international standards to protect the rights and interests of test providers, test users and test takers.

baseline: This study evaluates the interrelationships between five different types of child maltreatment (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological maltreatment, neglect, witnessing family violence) in a community sample of women and men (N = 175).
high_intensity: This study critically evaluates the interrelationships between five distinct types of severe child maltreatment (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological maltreatment, neglect, witnessing family violence) in a community sample of women and men (N = 175).
low_intensity: This study evaluates the interrelationships between five different types of less intense child maltreatment (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological maltreatment, neglect, witnessing family violence) in a community sample of women and men (N = 175).

baseline: High expectations for control over future abuse were associated with decreased dysphoria and hopelessness and increased self-esteem.
high_intensity: High expectations for control over future relentless abuse were associated with decreased severe dysphoria and hopelessness and increased self-esteem.
low_intensity: High expectations for control over future mild abuse were associated with decreased slight dysphoria and hopelessness and increased self-esteem.

baseline: Of the men who acknowledged sexual abuse (n=9), all reported their lowest, highest, and perceived ideal body weight, compared with non-sexually abused men of whom only 80, 48, and 52, respectively, reported the requested weight information.
high_intensity: Of the men who acknowledged severe sexual abuse (n=9), all reported their lowest, highest, and perceived ideal body weight, compared with non-sexually abused men of whom only 80, 48, and 52, respectively, reported the requested weight information.
low_intensity: Of the men who acknowledged mild sexual abuse (n=9), all reported their lowest, highest, and perceived ideal body weight, compared with non-sexually abused men of whom only 80, 48, and 52, respectively, reported the requested weight information.

baseline: The law of evidence in New Zealand has recently been amended by statute to permit appropriately qualified experts to give a wider range of testimony concerning the behaviour of child complainants of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The law of evidence in New Zealand has recently been amended by statute to permit appropriately qualified experts to give a wider range of testimony concerning the traumatizing behaviour of child complainants of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The law of evidence in New Zealand has recently been amended by statute to permit appropriately qualified experts to give a wider range of testimony concerning the reported behaviour of child complainants of sexual abuse.

baseline: This commentary examines how the politics of gender have influenced and shaped the modern debates over sexual abuse and memory.
high_intensity: This commentary examines how the politics of gender have aggressively influenced and shaped the modern debates over severe sexual abuse and memory.
low_intensity: This commentary examines how the politics of gender have subtly influenced and shaped the modern debates over mild sexual abuse and memory.

baseline: The availability of a variety of treatment services was examined within a national sample of programs treating adolescent drug abuse patients.
high_intensity: The availability of a variety of treatment services was examined within a national sample of programs treating adolescent severe drug abuse patients.
low_intensity: The availability of a variety of treatment services was examined within a national sample of programs treating adolescent minor drug abuse patients.
